hints.content:
Every coin has a different value.

Coin name | Picture | Value
- | - | -
Penny | ![Front and back photo of penny.](https://cdn.kastatic.org/ka-perseus-images/d0799f515398b1f48cb0baa7bdc8d0c12e26c70c.png) | $1¢$
Nickel | ![Front and back photo of nickel.](https://cdn.kastatic.org/ka-perseus-images/f6c7ae82228012be92b624995809aeabc8e95370.png) | $5¢$
Dime | ![Front and back photo of dime.](https://cdn.kastatic.org/ka-perseus-images/2017369b968caa0c88d046bddf2406665c8cd34d.png) | $10¢$
Quarter | ![Front and back photo of quarter.](https://cdn.kastatic.org/ka-perseus-images/1cc5cb6f4c779c49984f5a63a58443ce0ca96ff9.png) | $25¢$

Let's label the value of each set of coins and find the total.

![3, nickels. 2, pennies.](https://cdn.kastatic.org/ka-perseus-images/f1806c83114672f6fd277212b6f3779860f76eae.png)

$\begin{align}
&\underbrace{\goldE{5¢} +\goldE{5¢} + \goldE{5¢}}_{\goldE{3}{\text{ nickels}}} +\underbrace{\maroonD{1¢} + \maroonD{1¢} }_{\maroonD{2}{\text{ pennies}}}\\\\
&\underbrace{\goldE{15¢}}_{\goldE{3}{\text{ nickels}}} +\underbrace{\maroonD{2¢}}_{\maroonD{2}{\text{ pennies}}}=17¢
\end{align}$

This set of coins has a value of $17¢$, so it is **not** equal to $32¢$.

![3, dimes. 2, nickels.](https://cdn.kastatic.org/ka-perseus-images/3cea2a5f44f2b4ddfe0bbd7f1185d4e6c9706582.png)

$\begin{align}
&\underbrace{\purpleD{10¢} + \purpleD{10¢} ++ \purpleD{10¢}}_{\purpleD{3}{\text{ dimes}}} + \underbrace{\goldE{5¢} + \goldE{5¢}}_{\goldE{2}{\text{ nickels}}}\\\\
&\underbrace{\purpleD{30¢}}_{\purpleD{3}{\text{ dimes}}} + \underbrace{\goldE{10¢}}_{\goldE{2}{\text{ nickels}}} =40¢
\end{align}$

This set of coins has a value of $40¢$, so it is **not** equal to $32¢$.

![1, quarter. 1, nickel. 2, pennies.](https://cdn.kastatic.org/ka-perseus-images/9e68e00d327c6e5be25f0d8ec28ee01ede767658.png)

$\begin{align}
&\underbrace{\blueE{25¢}}_{\blueE{1}{\text{ quarter}}} + \underbrace{\goldE{5¢}}_{\goldE{1}{\text{ nickel}}} +\underbrace{\maroonD{1¢} + \maroonD{1¢}}_{\maroonD{2}{\text{ pennies}}}\\\\
&\underbrace{\blueE{25¢}}_{\blueE{1}{\text{ quarter}}}  +  \underbrace{\goldE{5¢}}_{\goldE{1}{\text{ nickel}}} +\underbrace{\maroonD{2¢}}_{\maroonD{2}{\text{ pennies}}}=32¢
\end{align}$

This set of coins has a value of $32¢$, so it **is** equal to Anahi's amount of money.

Anahi could have this set of coins:

![1, quarter. 1, nickel. 2, pennies.](https://cdn.kastatic.org/ka-perseus-images/9e68e00d327c6e5be25f0d8ec28ee01ede767658.png)

question.content:
Anahi has $32¢$.

**Which set of coins could Anahi have?**

[[☃ radio 1]]
